conclusion: Analyze the process and use the given information to determine the work done by the gas from state B to state C.
The process from state B to state C is a horizontal line on the PV diagram, indicating constant pressure at 0.6p0.
At state B, the volume is V0. At state C, the volume is 0.5V0.
The change in volume ΔV is calculated as 0.5V0 - V0 = -0.5V0.
The work done by the gas during a constant pressure process is given by W = P ΔV.
Substitute P = 0.6p0 and ΔV = -0.5V0 into the work formula to get W = 0.6p0 × (-0.5V0) = -0.3p0V0.
The negative sign indicates that work is done on the gas (i.e., the gas is compressed), rather than by the gas.
The work done by the gas when it changes from state B to state C is -0.3p0V0.
